bio.1: I’m Dania Alnahdi, a Boston-based web developer from Bahrain with a focus on design and product. I’m passionate about web and software development, innovative and human-centered technology, and interactive (and pretty) user interfaces.
bio.2: I graduated with a BS in Computer Science and Design from Northeastern University, and I'm currently pursuing an MS in Innovation and Management at Tufts University. Thanks to my academic coursework, industry experience at CarGurus, ASICS Digital, and MFS, and the numerious internet rabbit holes I tumble into, I’m always exploring new skills from both the development and design worlds.
bio.3: When I’m not behind my computer, you’ll likely find me advocating for causes I’m passionate about, discovering plant-based food joints, or petting my cat.

project1.name: OneASICS
project1.description: During my ASICS Digital co-op, I worked on OneASICS: the authentication portal used across ASICS' fitness and e-commerce apps. My main task was updating the registration's interface and error handling logic, decreasing user errors by 37%.

project2.name: Personal Website
project2.description: This very website! My goal was to create a responsive website from scratch using modern JavaScript tooling. I also added my own illustrations for a more personalized feel.

project3.name: Build for Black Lives
project3.description: An online platform that connects Black businesses and organizations to developers and creatives offering pro bono services. I was able to kickstart and collaborate on this initiative as an organizer for HackBeanpot!

project4.name: Eco Eateries
project4.description: This winning hackathon project is a goal-tracker for restaurants to adopt sustainable business practices. As the only frontend developer on the team, I was in charge of building the user interface, which included an interactive Kanban board.

project5.name: Security Council Database
project5.description: For my database course, my team created a database of United Nations data with the goal of making information on global issues more accessible. To demonstrate our work, I coded and deployed this full-stack, online directory, which included creating an API.

project6.type: Web App + UX Research + UI Design
project6.name: Cubby
project6.description: A social-emotional learning digital classroom for young students.

project7.type: Mobile App + UX Research + UI Design
project7.name: Saltwater Classroom
project7.description: An educational and social platform for nonprofit Saltwater Classroom.

project8.name: Alumni Data Visualizations
project8.description: In my service-learning course, I led the development of information visualizations for the Massachusetts Promise Fellowship, an AmeriCorps organization. The interactive graphs are connected via two-way brushing and linking for advanced filtering.

contact.heading: Say hi!
